mainBoard.name: Liliana Vess
mainBoard.originalText:
+1: Target player discards a card.
-2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
-8: Put all creature cards in all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

mainBoard.text:
[+1]: Target player discards a card.
[−2]: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
[−8]: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."
mainBoard.name: Deathgreeter
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever another creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
mainBoard.text: Whenever another creature dies, you may gain 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off." —Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
mainBoard.name: Drudge Skeletons
mainBoard.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons.
mainBoard.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

mainBoard.flavorText: The line between dream and death is gauzy and fragile. She leads those too near it from one side to the other.
mainBoard.name: Faerie Macabre
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Discard Faerie Macabre: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards.

rulings.text: Faerie Macabre’s second ability can be activated only while it’s in your hand. You can do this any time you could cast an instant.
The targeted cards may be in the same graveyard or in different graveyards.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Discard Faerie Macabre: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards.

mainBoard.flavorText: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
mainBoard.name: Fleshbag Marauder
mainBoard.originalText: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you’ll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

As Fleshbag Marauder’s ability resolves, first you choose a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all those creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.

mainBoard.text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.

mainBoard.flavorText: Her cold wail echoes in the alleys and under-eaves, finding the unfortunate and turning their blood to ice.

mainBoard.flavorText: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.
mainBoard.name: Phyrexian Rager
mainBoard.originalText: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
mainBoard.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.
mainBoard.name: Ravenous Rats
mainBoard.originalText: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
mainBoard.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

mainBoard.name: Skeletal Vampire
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Skeletal Vampire enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a Bat: Put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice a Bat: Regenerate Skeletal Vampire.

rulings.text: You may pay the cost of Skeletal Vampire’s activated abilities by sacrificing any Bat, not just a Bat token it created.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Skeletal Vampire enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying.
{3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a Bat: Create two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying.
Sacrifice a Bat: Regenerate Skeletal Vampire.

mainBoard.name: Twisted Abomination
mainBoard.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn’t allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

mainBoard.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."
mainBoard.name: Urborg Syphon-Mage
mainBoard.originalText: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each other player loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
mainBoard.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each other player loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Graveyards are sacrilege! A waste of perfectly good bones." —Keren-Dur, necromancer lord

mainBoard.originalText:
Defender
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone.
mainBoard.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

mainBoard.flavorText: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
mainBoard.name: Corrupt
mainBoard.originalText: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player’s life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you’ll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

mainBoard.text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

mainBoard.name: Ichor Slick
mainBoard.originalText:
Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
Madness {3}{B} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: If you cycle Ichor Slick, you may cast it for its madness cost. You choose whether or not to cast it with madness before you draw a card from the cycling effect.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

mainBoard.text:
Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
Madness {3}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.
mainBoard.name: Mutilate
mainBoard.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.

rulings.text: The effect is based on the number of Swamps you control when Mutilate resolves. Only creatures on the battlefield at that time will be affected. The effect won’t change later in the turn, even if the number of Swamps you control changes.

mainBoard.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Death is no excuse for disobedience." —Liliana Vess
mainBoard.name: Rise from the Grave
mainBoard.originalText: Put target creature card in a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn’t overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can’t be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature’s colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave’s effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature’s types or subtypes.

mainBoard.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

mainBoard.flavorText: "You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?" —Xathrid demon
mainBoard.name: Sign in Blood
mainBoard.originalText: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
mainBoard.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.
mainBoard.name: Vicious Hunger
mainBoard.originalText: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
mainBoard.text: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: "A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize." —Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words
mainBoard.name: Hideous End
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Hideous End resolves, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. No one loses life.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The bigger they are, the faster they rot."
mainBoard.name: Snuff Out
mainBoard.originalText:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 4 life rather than pay Snuff Out's mana cost.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
mainBoard.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 4 life rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.flavorText: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.
mainBoard.name: Tendrils of Corruption
mainBoard.originalText: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

mainBoard.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

mainBoard.name: Bad Moon
mainBoard.originalText: Black creatures get +1/+1.
mainBoard.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.

mainBoard.name: Enslave
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

rulings.text: The owner of a card is the player who started the game with that card in their deck. If the card didn’t start the game in a deck, its owner is the player who brought the card into the game, via Living Wish or a similar effect.
A token’s owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

mainBoard.name: Genju of the Fens
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant Swamp
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Swamp becomes a 2/2 black Spirit creature with "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn." It's still a land.
When enchanted Swamp is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fens from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it’s already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant Swamp
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Swamp becomes a 2/2 black Spirit creature with "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn." It's still a land.
When enchanted Swamp is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fens from your graveyard to your hand.
